trans-unit.source: Freezes a string literal when creating native images using the [Ngen.exe (Native Image Generator)](~/docs/framework/tools/ngen-exe-native-image-generator.md).
The <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.StringFreezingAttribute> class has been deprecated in the .NET Framework version 3.5 Service Pack 1 (SP1) and later versions.

A frozen string is a string literal object that is compatible with the managed heap and has been serialized into a native image by the [Ngen.exe (Native Image Generator)](~/docs/framework/tools/ngen-exe-native-image-generator.md).
The <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.StringFreezingAttribute> attribute allows you to optimize your code by pre-allocating string literals during native image generation rather than at run time.
After a string literal has been frozen, code can simply refer to the string using the address in the native image.
The <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.StringFreezingAttribute> must be applied on the assembly level.
Note that the common language runtime (CLR) cannot unload any native image that has a frozen string because any object in the heap might refer to the frozen string.
Therefore, you should use the <xref:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.StringFreezingAttribute> class only in cases where the native image that contains the frozen string is shared heavily.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.CompilerServices.StringFreezingAttribute"></xref> class.
